content.question: Which of the following correctly compares the temperatures <math alttext="T sub 1" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>T</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </math>, <math alttext="T sub 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="T sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> of samples <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, T sub 1 equals T sub 3, close parenthesis, is greater than T sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub 2 is greater than, open parenthesis, T sub 1 equals T sub 3, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="T sub 1 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="T sub 3 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="T sub 3 is greater than T sub 2, which is greater than T sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>T</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

topic.text: 9.1: Kinetic Theory of Temperature and Pressure

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
